title: The Core Problem We Face in Modern Software Development

content_blocks.text: I have more ideas than time to execute them all
The constraint is always execution speed, not creativity
We need to amplify our capabilities to match our ambitions

speaker_notes: This is the fundamental challenge every developer faces. We're idea-rich but time-poor.

title: How AI Changes Everything About Building Software

content_blocks.text: AI acts as a force multiplier for human creativity
We can now generate entire modules from specifications
The bottleneck shifts from coding to designing
Quality emerges from clear contracts, not manual review

speaker_notes: The paradigm shift is from writing code to describing what we want.

title: The Brick and Stud Philosophy for Modern Development

content_blocks.text: A brick is a self-contained module with one clear responsibility
A stud is the public contract that other bricks connect to
Bricks can be regenerated without breaking connections
All code, tests, and fixtures live inside the brick's folder
The contract is the specification, not the implementation

speaker_notes: This is how we build software that's both flexible and stable.

title: Embracing Regeneration Over Modification

content_blocks.text: Stop thinking about code as something to edit line by line
Think of it as something to describe and regenerate
AI generates fresh code from specifications every time
No technical debt accumulates when you regenerate

speaker_notes: This is the key mindset shift - we're not maintaining code, we're maintaining specifications.
